snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said an increase to 8 percent from 5 percent, which is to be combined with stimulus measures, would help “maintain confidence” in Japan’s fiscal health.
abstract: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe says he will raise sales tax to 8 percent from 5 percent in 2014, in bid to tackle country's enormous debt; also announces stimulus package of 6 trillion yen, or $61 billion.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said an increase to 8 percent from 5 percent, which is to be combined with stimulus measures, would help “maintain confidence” in Japan’s fiscal health.

headline.main: Japan Sales Tax to Increase Next Year, Abe Says
headline.print_headline: In Attempt to Tackle Its Debt, Japan Will Raise Taxes
